medical_history.chief_complaint: Dull, crampy pain and bloating in the lower abdomen.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began several days prior to the ED visit, worsening with bowel movements and bending over, radiating to both sides of the lower back. Pain was slightly relieved with Tylenol and was not associated with nausea, vomiting, or changes in bowel habits. Pain intensified over time, leading to the ED visit. Following ED treatment and antibiotic use, symptoms persisted with increased bowel movements but normal consistency. Pain severity led to a return to the ED.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypothyroidism, Hypercholesterolemia, Arthritis, Hypertension, Hernia repair, Lipoma removal, Recurrent microhematuria, Recurrent UTI, Tubal ligation, Sinus surgery, Gallbladder removal (suspected).
